Posts.Content: Apr 24, 2010 01:56PM sunnyhou wrote: Hi there I happened to see this on active post. You might try posting on the DCIS forum. You will get more responses, although the weekend can be slow. I am a DCIS girl. I am 38 and was diagnosed last September. I chose bilateral out of fear. I did not want to do tamoxofin or radiation and I did not want follow ups every six months forever. My mom had it and chose lumpectomy, radiation and tamoxofin and 14 years later still goes every 6 months. This is fine for her because she is not a worrier. I would be holding my breath all of the time waiting for the other shoe to drop. I am happy with my results, and I am glad I chose double. I had a mammo and mri that said the "good" side was clear and healthy and it ended up having atypical lobular hyperplasia in it. So, I could have been dealing with a another DCIS diagnosis in my future. This is really a personal decision. Some woman do not mind the check ups etc. some choose what I did. Some women choose lumpectomy and do not get good margins and have to do a mastectomy in the end. I would go to the DCIS board and read as much as possible. Go with your gut instinct. Blessings to you, I know how hard it was when I first found out and all I went through to make a decision.
